job_title: Psych Tech in Rochester, MN
pros: Easy to get time off, great communication between different departments, positive attitudes
cons: I genuinely can't think of any cons. Prairie Care does a fantastic job of making sure their employees know they are appreciated.

job_title: Resident Counselor Supevisor in Maple Grove, MN
pros: 401k matching and tuition payback plan
cons: Overworked, underpaid, far too much is expected from staff personally in a very highly stressful environment.

job_title: Psychiatric Technician in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Good pay Great shifts for technicians Supportive Coworkers
cons: High acuity and very little support for technician's as far as curriculum and training for the 'groups' we are supposed to lead.

job_title: Psychiatric Technician in Brooklyn Park, MN
pros: Benefits are decent. Opportunity to learn a lot about mental health and work hands on with patients. Great if you are a people person or love kids/understand kids and aren’t intimidated by kids with behavioral struggles.
cons: As a support staff, company culture makes you feel like you’re nobody. Very low pay for people with bachelor degrees with not much opportunity to advance without further schooling…leads to extremely high turnover. You can never win here, support staff always have to compromise on something: either pay or hours, ex: working weekends, nights, holidays or lower pay. Also you will NOT spend time directly with kids nearly as much as you’d expect if you work in outpatient. Workflow of the day is draining. Support jobs are extremely boring at one minute and busy the next. Position requires a high level of teamwork that is practically impossible with the amount of turnover.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Brooklyn Park, MN
pros: Great job and support. Definitely a different ficus than med-surge or acute care. I enjoyed the work and had a great supervisor and scheduler. I was sad to leave but pursued other goals
cons: Computer system stinks. If they changed the system everyone could work more efficiently. But everyone helps with questions.

job_title: Food Service Director in Brooklyn Park, MN
pros: Flexible time but difficult work environment
cons: Not good manager and benefits

review_title: Think twice before taking this job
job_title: Psychiatric Technician in Maplewood, MN
pros: Coworkers make this job so much better. Being able to connect with the patients and gain experience in the mental health field alongside multiple disciplines.
cons: - Management - Pay - Unsupportive staff - Toxic work environment

job_title: Therapist in Maplewood, MN
pros: Great support, overall very positive experience.
cons: Some challenges with changes in leadership,

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Brooklyn Park, MN
pros: Safe work environment. A lot of available shifts to work if you want overtime. Schedulers are flexible and help work with you to get time off when needed. High pto accrual. Fair compensation. Facility is new and very aesthetic and clean work environment.
cons: Large ratio for RN to patient load. Usually have 10-11 patients per one nurse. Not a lot of experienced staff that stay for a long time. Lack of strong leadership in the company.

job_title: Psych Tech in Brooklyn Park, MN
pros: In PHP you work Mon-Fri from about 8am - 4:30pm
cons: Poor management Not much opportunity for raise

review_title: One of the Best Places I Have Worked!
job_title: Occupational Therapist in Mankato, MN
pros: I feel like my input matters. My supervisors have all been amazing supports. I feel like my company truly supports my development as a professional. I can accomplish my career goals here. I work with the best team, both in how we work together and how everyone is here providing the best support to patients and their fellow staff members.
cons: Delays in getting OT specific templating in the documentation systems, but it is a work in progress and will take time (especially with how new OT is to PrairieCare).

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Woodbury, MN
pros: Caring co-workers and meaningful work.
cons: Toxic work environment in Woodbury. Director disrespects staff, gossips, backstabs, lies to make herself look good. Just terrible, and upper management doesn’t do anything about it.

review_title: Great place to learn and work
job_title: Therapist in Brooklyn Park, MN
pros:
Lots of investment in staff training
Community partnerships
Meaningful work
Great culture / coworkers
cons:
Difficulty with upward mobility at times
Pay structure can be confusing

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Brooklyn Park, MN
pros:
- They offer decent pay and benefits.
- Always plenty of OT opportunities.
- A few genuinely caring and nice people work there.
cons:
- Lots of turnover that then forces/nadates overtime.
- Many young staff that come in too tired to work or hung over
- If you question anything, you will be labeled as "having an attitude" or "a problem".
- Very cliquey. If you don't fit in at first, you probably won't; leading to gossip and outright lies about certain people. 
- Finger pointing and blame when things go wrong versus people owning their mistakes.
- Having to physically restrain patients with no wiggle room to deviate from the specific way they train you to do so. Leads to unnecessary injuries.
- Critical Incidents are traumatic for both the patients and the staff.
- Nurses will utilize Injectable Medication for patients more often then what seems necessary, just to make the shift easier.
- Supervisors play favorites and the departments don't seem to work well together.
- If someone complains about you, you're guilty, don't bother trying to tell your side of things.

job_title: Psychiatric Technician in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Great clinical experience, nice co-workers, decent pay, and a welcoming environment where the needs of each patient are uniquely considered.
cons: Can be an overwhelming job

job_title: Psychiatric Technician in Brooklyn Park, MN
pros: I really enjoyed the coworkers and team support in the role. I learned so much about the mental health field and loved working with the kids. Opportunities for bonus shift and overtime were abundant.
cons: Great benefits, however hourly compensation is lacking and pay gaps in the same role became evident. Middle management lacks communication with floor staff and although they as for feedback and suggestions, often failed to follow through with addressing employee concerns. Mandates also get a little out of hand with staffing shortages.

review_title: Learned a lot but also faced major burnout
job_title: Inpatient Social Worker in Brooklyn Park, MN
pros: Competitive pay and I LOVED my coworkers. We became a family a got really close.
cons: Hierarchy is very evident and burnout does not help. Frequently feels as though management doesn't set employees up for long-term success but rather want quick results. I was promised a caseload of no more than 9 patients and typically had around 12-14 patients. The position was also advertised to have much more clinical in it than reality - a lot of case management and is extremely fast paced which can be fun with a 9 patient case load but is quickly exhausting if you have more. Frequent turnover in social work department due to burnout and lack of feeling validated with reasonable solutions to problems by management - we can tell that management cares but they themselves are overworked and therefore don't have the resources to adequately support. There is not much room to grow outside of the position - it very much feels as though they design the position to only be entry level as you don't get extra compensation for a high licensure.

review_title: Great place to work for already busy individuals
job_title: Medical Receptionist in Brooklyn Park, MN
pros: I have worked here throughout the last year of college and it has been a very accommodating workplace! I am able to be flexible with my hours and days off for final exams!
cons: With there being short staff during COVID-19, I have had to pick up different hours on my off time from school.

job_title: Community Relations Coordinator in Brooklyn Park, MN
pros: PrairieCare is a place that is dedicated to serving individuals facing Mental Health concerns. I have been with PrairieCare for 3.5 years and have always seen how closely the work we do aligns with the Mission of our organization. PrairieCare provides me educations opportunities, career advancement and a team of like minded individuals.
cons: I have some poor managers in the past but within the last year a new one came on for our team and it has been great change.

job_title: Psychiatric Technician in Brooklyn Park, MN
pros: Great kids and patient interactions, okay pay, consistent hours, learning by observation
cons: Little opportunity for growth, financially unstable company, rude coworkers, inconsiderate upper management, power hierarchy that silences certain voices

review_title: Patients are great, opportunities to get involved and speak your voice
job_title: Psychiatric Technician in Brooklyn Park, MN
pros:
- Patients are awesome and you get a lot of interaction
- Tons of opportunity for overtime and bonuses
- Most co-workers are great
cons:
- Supervisors are either absent or overbearing
- no yearly raises
- No maternity leave!

job_title: Residential Counselor II in Maple Grove, MN
pros:
The overall company remains true to their stated mission, transforming Mental Health Care. They have improved over the past two years in how they deliver said care and have somewhat improved with staff appreciation.

They have also been recently generous with their pay, making it reasonably competitive.

The place I work at (residential) is a great spot to get introduced to the field, with a decent pay.
cons:
True to many of the reviews here, staff accountability appears to be somewhat low. If a staff is lacking on their end, its difficult to get any follow through from management on improving the team's functioning. 

Like any mental health job it is always draining and staff are prone to burning out. Turnover is common (this is common in the industry)

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Brooklyn Park, MN
pros:
- great place to begin a career in the mental health field and/or gaining experience & clinical skills serving a diverse population. There is a trickle down effect, where you can learn from the more experienced staff and doctors.
- co-workers are very supportive and its easy to get along with everyone, which extends from management to floor staff. Everyone seems committed to providing the best care possible for the children and adolescents we serve.
cons:
- fast paced environment and the need to be flexible, adapting to change daily
- need to watch for burnout

review_title: Great work culture, and caring managers
job_title: Outpatient Therapist in Brooklyn Park, MN
pros: I have grown so much working at PrairieCare. They really work hard to develop staff and there are so many opportunities to learn new things and develop new skills. I also really like the multidisciplinary teams- I feel like I learn a lot from my coworkers.
cons: The work is very fast paced and the patient care is generally pretty acute. If you're looking for a very predictable job, this is probably not it.

job_title: Psychiatric Technician in Edina, MN
pros: I really enjoy being able to take what I am learning in school and apply it to creative activities I get to teach the patients. It’s fun and motivating to work alongside other young people who are passionate about the field. It’s also helpful to practice establishing trust and meaningful connections with many different people.
cons: Management is poor in the float pool for the partial hospitalization programs. You rarely, if at all, get spoken to if you are doing things right—it’s only when you have made a mistake that you are addressed (thus creating a negative and fearful relationship between supervisor and employee). They also will work you tirelessly, to the point where it affects the genuineness of care you can offer, unless you establish secure boundaries. Practice and be confident asking for breaks!

job_title: Purchasing Coordinator in Brooklyn Park, MN
pros: PrairieCare has a great Mission/Vision/Value for the work they do and show it daily to the patients/families and employees. I feel blessed to be part of an organization that cares for the community and their employees. I have a supervisor that truly listens to me and wants the best for our team. As I look around the organization we truly have a great group of supervisors and management that care about their staff.
cons: The only "con" of working for PrairieCare is that sometimes the background employees get forgotten as attention is given to our frontline workers.

job_title: Staff RN in Brooklyn Park, MN
pros: They are competitive with hourly pay.
cons: Overall, cannot match health insurance and retirement benefits with most major medical institutions.

job_title: Administrative in Edina, MN
pros:
- wonderful co-worker
-Rewarding to work with patient's and their family
-Benefits
-team work
-great training opportunities
-Ability to grow within the company in a timely manner
cons:

-Pay rate is not always the best, but is improving

review_title: While working at Prairie Care I've had the pleasure of meeting some of the most caring individuals in the field..

pros: TEAM approach my feedback is valued. Awesome trainings.
cons: I don't have an answer due to such an welcoming and healthy environment.

job_title: Needs Assessment Counselor in Brooklyn Park, MN

job_title: Medical Receptionist in Edina, MN
pros: Good location and cafeteria tunnel.
cons: There are only a few entry-level girls who are in charge of medical receeptionists. They control their co-workers with bullying tactics. They will not speak to you. They will force you out. Thus, the revolving door of medical receptionists. Do not even consider this position.

review_title: Prairie Care is turning a corner for the better!

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Brooklyn Park, MN
pros: A mission-driven organization that focuses on both staff and patient needs. Everybody's voice can be heard. Lot's of opportunities for growth. Good communication, transparent messaging to staff.
cons: Lots of demand for services which varies throughout the year. The work itself can be stressful.

job_title: Psych Technician in Brooklyn Park, MN
pros: New building and esthetics were decent

job_title: Intake Advisor in Brooklyn Park, MN
pros: None really. I hated my time there

job_title: Registered Nurse in Rochester, MN
pros: Hours, pay, mission, location, multidisciplinary
cons: Management, inconsistencies, unprofessional, closed door, shaming

job_title: Psychiatric Technician in Rochester, MN
pros: Education on site. Awesome coworkers to learn from and look up to.

job_title: Health Unit Coordinator in Brooklyn Park, MN
pros: Free parking lot was always clean

job_title: Psychiatric Technician in Brooklyn Park, MN
pros: The staff are trying to keep up on relevant research and incorporate it into programming. Cool new person-centered initiatives are happening. Most of the staff really care about their jobs and care about applying evidence based techniques in their groups.  The facility is gorgeous.
cons: Sometimes nursing staff or nursing management places a higher value on patient compliance to programing. Compliance does not equal treatment. Trying to force and coerce patients into groups using punitive measures can burn out the employees and not help the patients. We didn't go to school to make people do stuff, we went to school to help.  Also there high employee turn-over. I wonder if this is due to the difficulty of maintaining a rotating schedule? Flipping from PM's to AM's or NOC's really messes with peoples sleep schedule and wellbeing.  There is not a lot of room for growth. Moving from a tech 1 to a tech 2 to a tech  3 doesn't offer much more money. The benefits are expensive if you have kids.

job_title: Psychiatric Technician in Brooklyn Park, MN
pros:
Experience with many different types of patients.
A few good leaders (often overruled by poor leaders)
Many amazing psych techs and nurses (often the best go unrecognized unless they are also favorited)
cons:
Extremely toxic and hostile workplace encouraged by most upper management. They reward and promote based on favoritism while punishing harshly those they dislike. The training program is very poorly carried out with new employees often leading to on the floor mistakes when the employees finish training. Tattling, lying, and passive aggressiveness is “frowned upon” however there have been supervisors who create and fuel rumors as well as act vindictively. HR has no interest in employee welfare. Very undereducated and unprofessional when dealing with serious matters. Reporting any sort of concern you have can easily lead to retaliation and get you fired. Although they deny this over and over they have a long history of suspicious terminations. Overall concern is money. Not patients. 
Mental health discrimination is frequent even though this is a mental health hospital. 
They do not follow own mission and values. And when this is pointed out they target you and take you out  instead of take the constructive advice.

review_title: I enjoy this community and the support I get
job_title: Residential Counselor in Maple Grove, MN
pros: Opportunity for growth, caring team
cons: Incompetent coworker at entry level positions

job_title: Psychiatric Technician in Brooklyn Park, MN
pros:
-Don't specifically need a college degree; can still be in college and get fantastic psychiatric experience
-PTO accrues fast
-Some fantastic coworkers who hold the company up
cons:
-Low pay for the work we do
-Too high of a patient load during some day shifts and weekend shifts when only one tech/one nurse is scheduled
-Select nurses who don't interact or talk with patients and stay solely behind the desk (increasing the workload exponentially for techs) 
-Bad communication between clinical staff and techs
-Belittlement of the work that psychiatric technicians do on a daily basis
-Techs are stretched to their limits at times and high turnover happens
-Some fantastic nurses and techs, however they are intermixed with some untrained  staff that are unable to handle psychiatric cases, which creates extreme stress and frustrations at work when staffed with these individuals.
-The company feels like it's going under, especially after closure of the ICU and very low staff raises this year.

job_title: Social Work in Brooklyn Park, MN
pros: PrairieCare is a growing mental healthcare organization, which means there are new opportunities to grow all around you.  Wonderful team of social workers for consultation and support.  Interdisciplinary approach and respect from team members from other disciplines. I liked the workplace environment, many motivated young professionals.  If you asked, most people would say they love their job across all disciplines.
cons:
The organization is growing quickly, which felt like it took away from attending to current employee needs and creating stability with existing programs. 
Great for a new SWer out of school, or LGSW working towards LICSW.  Not many opportunities for growth for a LICSW in a SW role, the growth is to move into a therapy role.

job_title: TMS Psychiatric Technician in Edina, MN
pros: Okay pay and work with the patients is rewarding.
cons: The work environment is extremely toxic and there is little room for growth. They won't train you but reprimand you harshly for mistakes no matter how small. If they don't like you or if you point out any issues with their system or lack of training they will make your life hell just to get you to quit. There is no communication and people often gang up on new employees. If you are a person of color or muslim they will constantly complain about you and treat you even worse. The micromanaging and nit-picking is extremely degrading. Don't waste your time in this company if you are looking for somewhere to grow.

job_title: Professional in Mankato, MN
pros: Compensation, friendly coworkers, growing company
cons: Gossip and lack of communication from management, management falls for gossip and does not stand up for workers, they do not let you know of areas of improvement, each building uses forms and documentation differently as well as each program, doctors at multiple buildings have egos that negatively impact other professionals.

review_title: If you value a work-life balance, apply elsewhere
job_title: Unit Secretary in Brooklyn Park, MN
pros: A pro of working at PrairieCare is that the facility is clean and updated.
cons:
-They offer you a "generous" PTO package and then make it nearly impossible to use. Even with 6 weeks advance notice, I was harassed and discouraged by both my supervisor and my co-workers from using my PTO over the HOLIDAYS. The hospital is open 24/7, therefore, you must use your paid time off if you wish to have time off on a holiday. Every time I requested to even use one day of time off, I was asked why I needed time off and if I could work a partial day. 
-This place is understaffed and therefore all of the staff is overworked. It makes for a hostile work environment.
-After over a year of employment, I had never had an employee review (even though it was promised upon being hired), and was never offered a raise. This is because of their supposed lack of funds and lack of proper management, not due to employee performances.
-They are "slow" in the summer, so be prepared to be laid off in June-August or furloughed with only one day of  notice for an unspecified amount of time if you were hired in the previous year.
-I worked overtime 4/5 days a week and voluntarily came in to work on weekends to make up for the work that could not be completed during the normal 40 hour work week due to lack of employees, and was encouraged to 'flex' hours in the two-week pay period versus being properly compensated for overtime work.
-They do not care about their employees, they have a poor business model, and they have serious issues with retaining employees for longer than a year.

review_title: Company with great values but narrow-minded
job_title: Psychiatric Technician in Brooklyn Park, MN
pros: Great people. They really take their time in hiring good, quality employees - specifically for upper management.
cons: There seems to be a few toxic employees that ruin it for everyone else. Executives are too narrow-minded. Difficult to promote within

job_title: Needs Assessment Counselor in Brooklyn Park, MN
pros: I worked for PrairieCare for about a year and felt very supported. The rapid growth of the organization creates many opportunities, and I feel benefits and salary are very fair/competitive.
cons: The hours were challenging at times, though this was known going into the job.

review_title: Not your typical health care provider
